results.title: Distant voices, still lives
results.creator_credit: BFI, Channel Four, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Jennifer Howarth and Terence Davies
results.brief_description: This is the first feature film of Liverpudlian Terence Davies, obviously autobiographical, dealing with a family named Davies and their lives during the 1940s and 1950s. The film is divided into two parts: “Distant voices” (45 mins) centers on the wedding of Eileen, eldest of the three Davies children, and the funeral of her father, events which spark memories of the past, including the frightening war years when the city was bombed frequently. “Still lives” (39 mins), actually filmed two years after the first part, with the same actors but with a substantially different crew. It’s a seamless continuation of the recollections of their domineering and irrational father, played against music and radio programmes of the period to create an evocative and moving picture of family life in the 1940s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BFI, Channel Four, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Jennifer Howarth and Terence Davies

results.title: Dirty rotten scoundrels (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Bernard Williams and Frank Oz
results.brief_description: In Beaumont-sur-mer on the French Riviera, Lawrence Jamison (Michael Caine), a suave stylish con man who is an expert at extracting jewels from rich, married women must find a way to deal with crass new competition in the person of Freddy Benson (Steve Martin), a small time scam artist who tells tragic tales about his grandma to secure a few francs from almost anyone! Eventually they decide to compete and make a wager that whoever cannot swindle a certain naive soap heiress (Glenne Headly) for $50,000 must leave the French Riviera hunting ground. A remake of the 1964 “Bedtime stories”.

results.title: Dirty pretty things
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, BBC Film Unit, Tracey Seaward, Robert Jones and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: An illegal immigrant in urban London, Okwe, is working as a cab driver and doing the nightshift as a hotel receptionist (Chiwetel Ejiofor). He is sharing a flat with one of the hotel’s maids, Senay, (Audrey Tautou’s first English speaking role) who is also an illegal but dreams of escaping to live in America. Initially the film is more a character study of the pair always living in fear of deportation and struggling with poverty but soon develops into a thriller as one night, a gruesome discovery in room 510’s blocked toilet, leads to blackmail and involvement with London’s sordid underworld. Cast includes Sergi Lopez, Benedict Wong and Sophie Okonedo.

results.title: Dirty Harry
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Warner Bros Pictures and Don Siegel
results.brief_description: Harry Callaghan is a tough, streetwise San Francisco cop whom they call Dirty Harry. In this classic film, you will see why. You will also see why Clint Eastwood’s reputation is secure. No other actor can match his presence. He is magnetising in his portrayal as the shoot-first-ask-questions-later law enforcer who must hunt a psychotic roof-top killer who has slain two people and has kidnapped a girl and threatens to suffocate her if his ransom demands are not met. Harry will get him… one way or the other… no matter what the “system” prescribes. Moody cinematography and stunning location filming propel the story and capitalise upon Eastwood’s commanding presence. Watch this film and ask yourself: Do you feel lucky?

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pam Marsden, Ralph Zondag and Eric Leighton
results.brief_description: Computer animated feature from Walt Disney Pictures, artfully combined live action backgrounds with CGI pre-historic beasts. This family oriented adventure movie is about an orphaned dinosaur raised by lemurs. Years later when the inhabitants flee the continent, Aladar, as he is known, encounters his own kind for the first time. The landmark animation of this feature was highly praised for its attention to detail and awe-inspiring aesthetics. Features the voices of D.B. Sweeney, Alfre Woodard, Ossie Davis, Max Casella, Hayden Panettiere, and Sam Wright.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pam Marsden, Eric Leighton and Ralph Zondag
results.brief_description: Lavish Disney family movie, “Dinosaur” broke new ground with its awe-inspiring aesthetics of computer animation, set against live action backgrounds. The simplistic story is pure Disney - Aladar is an iguanodon snatched by a pterodactyl whilst still in the egg; the egg, via a range of predators and mishaps, makes a treacherous journey across land and sea until a clan of lemurs adopt the baby as one of their own; when a meteor shower rattles the inhabitants of the continent, they decide to flee; en route, Aladar experiences life with his own kind for the first time. The film entertains a gentle, traditional family brand of humour that supports the themes of compassion, friendship and tolerance with a gentle nod toward respecting one’s elders. The predictable narrative progression, a conventional quest that supports a basic morality of good triumphing over evil, is overcome by the impressive animation and stupendous set pieces.

results.title: Dimboola [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Pram Factory Pictures, John Weiley and John Duigan
results.brief_description: Jack Hibberd’s famous stage comedy is brought to the screen by director John Duigan (“The Year My Voice Broke”). The wedding of Morrie (played by Bruce Spence) to Maureen (Natalie Bate) in the small country town of Dimboola is the setting for this story of “typical Aussie ratbags and oddballs doing typically dim-witted Aussie things usually whilst chucking back a tinnie and trying to crack on to a sheila” (according to critic Bernard Hemingway). A visiting English journalist (played by Max Gillies) observes and comments on the action. Filmed on location at Dimboola in western Victoria, and including many of the cast from the Australian Performing Group’s highly successful theatrical production, “Dimboola” is a colourful and uniquely Australian romp. Cast also includes Bill Garner, Evelyn Krape, Max Cullen, Max Fairchild, and Chad Morgan. This DVD edition also includes a filmed version of the original play as performed at the Pram Factory in 1973 and a 1994 documentary on the Australian Performing Group with some wonderful archival footage.

results.title: Diggers
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and Frank Thring
results.brief_description: This was the first feature film of the Melbourne enterprise Efftee Films and was adapted for the screen by Pat Hanna from three sketches from his popular Diggers stage show, which featured two Australian cobbers serving in the AIF in France in 1918. The first episode presents the two friends in their attempts to steal rum from a British Army Store; the second episode shows them relaxing in a French cafe while a fellow digger romances with the waitress; the final episode finds the diggers in hospital feigning illness to escape active duty. Cast includes Pat Hanna and George Moon.

results.title: Die hard (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Gordon Co, Silver Pictures, Lawrence Gordon, Joel Silver and John McTiernan
results.brief_description: Bruce Willis stars as New York Detective, John McClane, newly arrived in Los Angeles to spend the Christmas holiday with his estranged wife (Bonnie Bedelia). But as McClane waits for his wife’s office party to break up, terrorists seize control of the building. While terrorists leader Hans Gruber and his savage henchmen round up hostages, McClane slips away unnoticed. Armed with only a service revolver and his own cunning, McClane launches his own one-man war. A crackling action thriller from beginning to end, “Die Hard” explodes with heart-stopping suspense. Also stars Alan Rickman, Alexander Godunov and Bonnie Bedelia. From the novel by Roderick Thorp.
